intro: Viola conferta, commonly known as the common pansy, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is a member of the Violaceae family and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and vibrant, showy flowers that come in a variety of colors. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and prefers well-drained soil in partial to full shade. Viola conferta is often cultivated as an ornamental plant for its beauty and ability to thrive in cooler climates. Its flowers bloom from spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
